text: anyone use the video column in hubdb? All it returns is an id, that I assume is the player id? However, when I get this file’s player_id via API – `meta.video_data.hosting_infos.id` – it does not match what HubDB is spitting out – `{{ row.video_column }}`
thats a good point, i wasnt thinking bigger picture for a moment there lol
whoever added multi-select as a column type in HubDB - thank you! you just made a task way easier for me
you have `{{row.industrie}}` mispelled from the top. change it to `{{row.industries}}`

If I'm pulling an image from the hubDB e.g.  style="background-image:url({{ row.image.url }})" can I resize the image, the way that adding a width="X" to an image tag will resize and cache the resulting image??
I use resize_image_url obsessively, I make it a point to assume whoever is adding images has no idea what they’re doing lol

I have a HubDB with a select list, with options A, B, and C. For any option selected in the table, I want to show X, Y, or Z html, but only once. I was able to show X (for A), Y (for B), and Z (for C) only once, but they show up in all cases, even if A, B, or C are not selected. I run into this scenario often, but have never come up with a great solution. Is there a way to do a rowcount on this column or inside the select?
Do you have a template with a full example we could look at?

Hi Sylvia,

What is being shown at XYZ?

Can you add this as a column to your HubDB where the locations are stored?

This would simplify your if statements so you could just return the value from that column of the row shown.
